required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigating the Role of Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) Between Pain and Other Neuronal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Role of Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) Between Pain and Other Neuronal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Measure the cytokines, transforming or neurotrophic factors in CSF and plasma as the pain markers and as a new therapeutic target for pain control.

detailed_description.textblock: The research protocol was approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) for the Protection of Human Subjects at National Cheng Kung University Hospital (NCKUH/B-ER-104-070). The study procedures were performed according to the rules of IRB and fully explained to the participants. Blood and CSF samples were collected and compared the difference in no pain group, acute pain group, and chronic pain group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: cytokine measurement ( via ELISA) in cerebrospinal fluid

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: pain evaluation for patients performed surgery without painful condition (bleeding or others)
pain evaluation for patients performed surgery with painful condition within several days
pain evaluation for patients performed surgery with the painful condition for over months

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood (10 ml) was collected before surgery using venipuncture: the blood was drawn into a test tube that contained the anticoagulant ethylenediamine tetraacetic acid (EDTA). Blood and CSF samples were ice bathed and then transported to laboratory for biological molecule analysis. White blood cells and platelets were also counted before operation as a routinely pre-operative check

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- . Patients undergo spinal anesthesia
- . Over 20 years of age
- Patients who are competent to understand the study and provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients have the contraindication for spinal anesthesia (refuse spinal anesthesia, coagulopathy, severe aortic stenosis)
- Refuse participated in this study or pre-existent neurological disease.
- Patients with advanced tumor staging (stage 3 or 4).

patient_data.ipd_description: patient privacy and no patient consent
